intro: Steganthera fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
